text: Afterward Moses and Aaron went to Pharaoh and said, &#34Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel, &#39Let my people go, so that they may celebrate a festival to me in the wilderness.&#39&#34
But Pharaoh said, &#34Who is the LORD, that I should heed him and let Israel go? I do not know the LORD, and I will not let Israel go.&#34

Then they said, &#34The God of the Hebrews has revealed himself to us; let us go a three days&#39 journey into the wilderness to sacrifice to the LORD our God, or he will fall upon us with pestilence or sword.&#34
But the king of Egypt said to them, &#34Moses and Aaron, why are you taking the people away from their work? Get to your labors!&#34
Pharaoh continued, &#34Now they are more numerous than the people of the land and yet you want them to stop working!&#34
That same day Pharaoh commanded the taskmasters of the people, as well as their supervisors,
&#34You shall no longer give the people straw to make bricks, as before; let them go and gather straw for themselves.
But you shall require of them the same quantity of bricks as they have made previously; do not diminish it, for they are lazy; that is why they cry, &#39Let us go and offer sacrifice to our God.&#39
Let heavier work be laid on them; then they will labor at it and pay no attention to deceptive words.&#34
So the taskmasters and the supervisors of the people went out and said to the people, &#34Thus says Pharaoh, &#39I will not give you straw.
Go and get straw yourselves, wherever you can find it; but your work will not be lessened in the least.&#39&#34
So the people scattered throughout the land of Egypt, to gather stubble for straw.
The taskmasters were urgent, saying, &#34Complete your work, the same daily assignment as when you were given straw.&#34

And the supervisors of the Israelites, whom Pharaoh&#39s taskmasters had set over them, were beaten, and were asked, &#34Why did you not finish the required quantity of bricks yesterday and today, as you did before?&#34
Then the Israelite supervisors came to Pharaoh and cried, &#34Why do you treat your servants like this?
No straw is given to your servants, yet they say to us, &#39Make bricks!&#39 Look how your servants are beaten! You are unjust to your own people.&#34
He said, &#34You are lazy, lazy; that is why you say, &#39Let us go and sacrifice to the LORD.&#39
Go now, and work; for no straw shall be given you, but you shall still deliver the same number of bricks.&#34
The Israelite supervisors saw that they were in trouble when they were told, &#34You shall not lessen your daily number of bricks.&#34
As they left Pharaoh, they came upon Moses and Aaron who were waiting to meet them.
They said to them, &#34The LORD look upon you and judge! You have brought us into bad odor with Pharaoh and his officials, and have put a sword in their hand to kill us.&#34
Then Moses turned again to the LORD and said, &#34O LORD, why have you mistreated this people? Why did you ever send me?
Since I first came to Pharaoh to speak in your name, he has mistreated this people, and you have done nothing at all to deliver your people.&#34
